note: Poverty data is measured in [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) at 2017 prices to account for inflation and differences in the cost of living between countries. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita).
title: Vaccination coverage vs. share in extreme poverty
subtitle: The share of one-year-olds who received vaccinations against diphteria, pertussis, and tetanus (DTP3). Extreme poverty is defined as living on less than $2.15 per day.
